# Sarojini Yogeswaran

| death_place         = Jaffna, Sri Lanka
| nationality         =
| spouse              = Vettivelu Yogeswaran
| party               = Tamil United Liberation Front
| otherparty          =

Sarojini Yogeswaran (n√©e Ponnambalam; died in 1998) was the first female mayor of Jaffna, a city in northern Sri Lanka. She served from 1997 until her assassination. Yogeswaran was a member of the Tamil United Liberation Front and was the first elected mayor in 14 years.
Death
Yogeswaran was shot five times with a pistol near her Jaffna home on 17 May 1998.  She died on the way to hospital. An LTTE front organization called the Sankiliyan Force claimed responsibility.
